body.p: May 2007: The CZT web site got a new layout. It is now generated using Maven.
February 2007: Released version 2.1 of the ZML Schema.
August 2006: CZT meeting in York, UK.

July 2006: Fifth release (version 0.5) of CZT containing corejava 2.0.0, parser 0.5 (Z/Object Z parser and printing tools), typechecker 0.5 (Z/Object Z type checker), the first release of the Z animator zlive, the first release of the testing tool modeljunit, and several jedit plugins.
June 2006: Released version 2.0 of the ZML Schema.
Nov/Dec 2005: Paper "CZT Support for Z Extensions" presented at the IFM2005 conference in Eindhoven, The Netherlands.
November 2005: CZT developer meetings in York and Liverpool, UK.
September 2005: Forth release (version 0.4) of CZT containing corejava 1.4.1, parser 0.4 (Z/Object Z parser and printing tools), typechecker 0.4 (Z/Object Z type checker), and the jEdit plugin.
April 2005: CZT tutorial and paper at the ZB2005 conference in Guildford, UK.
March 2005: Third release (version 0.3) of CZT containing corejava 1.4.0 and parser 0.3 (Z/Object Z parser and printing tools), and first releases of the typechecker and jEdit plugin.
November 2004: Binary releases are available from Petra's web page.
September 2004: Second release (version 0.2) of CZT containing corejava 1.3.0 and parser 0.2 (Z/Object Z parser and printing tools).
August 2004: Released version 1.3 of the ZML Schema.
April 2004: First release (version 0.1) of CZT containing corejava 1.2.0 and parser 0.1 (Z/Object Z parser and printing tools).
April 2004: Released version 1.2.0 of the core Java classes for Z Annotated Syntax Trees. This release is based on ZML version 1.2.
April 2004: The Parser subproject got its own web site.
March 2004: Released version 1.2 of the ZML Schema.

January 2004: Released version 1.1.2 of the core Java classes for Z Annotated Syntax Trees. This release adds support for Object Z (based on an XML Schema provided by Li Yuan Fang) and experimental support for Z pattern.
November 2003: The core Java classes got their own web site.
October 2003: The CZT web site got a new layout. It is now generated using Forrest.
October 2003: Released version 1.1.1 of the core Java classes for Z Annotated Syntax Trees. This release fixes some bugs from the first version.
September 2003: Released first version (1.1.0) of the core Java classes for Z Annotated Syntax Trees. These were generated from the XML Schema for Z, by our gnast tool.
July 2003: Created this Sourceforge web site.
June 2003: Mark Utting et. al. presented an XML schema for Z at the ZB2003 conference in Turku, Finland, based on the DTD by Ian Toyn.
2002: Ian Toyn designed an XML DTD for Z, based on the abstract syntaxes of CadiZ, Zeta and the ISO Z standard.
2001: Andrew Martin proposed the CZT project.
